#summary Usage
#labels Featured,Phase-Support
= Introduction =
You can call check a file with cppcheck in different ways.
  # Automatically check a file, whenever it is built.
  # Manually check a file via the context menu on either the package/project explorer or within the C editor.
  # Manually check a file via the shortcut Ctrl+Shift+C (on Mac: Cmd+Shift+C).

All issues detected by cppcheck are reported in the error view of Eclipse. Additionally to that you can see the original output of cppcheck in the console view.


= Configuration =

You can either configure cppcheclipse for the whole workspace or separately for the individual projects.
